question: Can I qualify for a mortgage with a credit score of 700 and a debt-to-income ratio of 35%?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 700 and DTI of 35%, you are likely eligible. Ensure a down payment of 5-20% based on the loan type.

steps.content: Can I qualify for a mortgage with a credit score of 700 and a debt-to-income ratio of 35%?
Plan: 1) Confirm credit score with credit_agent. 2) Check DTI with home_loan_agent. 3) Retrieve additional mortgage requirement details. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Credit score 700 is confirmed as good for most mortgage types.
Retrieving knowledge on debt-to-income ratio requirements.
A DTI of 35% is within acceptable limits for most lenders.
Do I need a specific down payment amount?
Retrieving information on down payment requirements.
Down payment requirements vary from 5% to 20% depending on the mortgage type.
What interest rate can I expect?
Interest rates currently range from 3% to 4% for good credit scores.
Review completed. All criteria are satisfactorily met.
Yes, with a credit score of 700 and DTI of 35%, you are likely eligible. Ensure a down payment of 5-20% based on the loan type. Expect interest rates between 3% and 4%.
